objects.description:
Disabled, this case is a duplicate of  TC#3534

"As a user, I want the phone menu to display the high-level phone actions (including Turn off Airplane Mode, Silence Incoming Calls, Power off) when I long-press the power button,
so I can easily control the phone's important states."

Prerequisites:  Phone is in state where Airplane Mode is off.
objects.name: Airplane mode - using long press/power

steps.expected: Phone menu is displayed with the following options:  "Turn On Airplane mode", "Silence Incoming calls", "Restart", "Power off".  There is also a "Cancel" button at the bottom.
steps.instruction: Long press the power button.

objects.description:
As a user I want to be visually notified when Airplane mode is enabled or disabled so I can understand the state of my phones connections.

Please see this issue: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1034455
objects.name: [Settings] Enabling / Disabling Airplane Mode

steps.instruction: Launch Settings App.

steps.expected: An airplane icon appears in the upper right hand corner of the status bar. If Wireless or Data connection icons were previously shown in the Status Bar, they should not appear if Airplane mode is enabled.
steps.instruction: Enable Airplane Mode.

steps.expected: The airplane icon should not be present in notification tray with Airplane mode off. Wifi and/or Data connection icons should appear in the notification tray again if they were previously enabled.
steps.instruction: Disable Airplane Mode.

steps.expected: Airplane mode is still functioning properly without issue.
steps.instruction: Repeat steps 2 and 3 at least 20 times

objects.description:
This case checks that the functionality of homescreen works when the phone is booted, and that you can unlock the device through the Lockscreen

#Pre-Requisite:
#-Have a Sim PIN set
#-Have Phonelock toggled ON
objects.name: [HOME SCREEN] Verify that the User can unlock the device and navigate the Homescreen

steps.expected: The device is booted to the Lockscreen
steps.instruction: Power on the device

steps.expected: The device is unlocked and the Sim PIN disable prompt is given.
steps.instruction: On the Lockscreen, Slide to the right to unlock th phone.

steps.expected: Homescreen is launched and SIM is detected.
steps.instruction: Enter in SIM PIN to unlock SIM.

steps.expected: It is possible to navigate between pages, and all homescreen app icons are displayed correctly
steps.instruction: Pan down on the homescreen.

steps.expected: It is possible to navigate between pages, and all homescreen app icons are displayed correctly
steps.instruction: Pan up on the homescreen.

objects.description: It should be possible to launch the dialer, make an outgoing call, and adjust the call volume while the call is active.

objects.description:
Verify that when the device is Locked, it is able to receive a call, and that the vibration and sound from receiving a call functions correctly

#Pre-Requisite:
#-Have Ring Volume set above 50%
#-Have Vibrate and Ring Enabled
#-Have PhoneLock toggled ON
objects.name: [DIALER] Verify that the User can receive a call whilst the device is locked

steps.expected: The phone is locked and the screen is shut off
steps.instruction: From the Homescreen, Lock the device by pressing the power button
From a second device call the Locked device

steps.expected: Phone call should ring in to the locked device with vibration and sound
steps.instruction: The Locked device receives the call

objects.description:
It should be possible to receive a call, and if the phone is configured so, get vibration and ring tone, if the device is  unlocked.

Prerequisites:  The device is unlocked.
objects.name: [DIALER] Receive a call with vibration and sound (device unlocked)

steps.instruction: Go to Settings and Select Sound settings make sure volume is set at least half way.
Turn on "Vibrate" and "Ring" by enabling them.

steps.expected: It should be possible to receive a call with vibration and sound to the unlocked device.
steps.instruction: Call into the unlocked device

objects.description: It should be possible to activate/deactivate mute during a call.
objects.name: [DIALER]  Activate/Deactivate mute during a call

steps.instruction: Call the device from a separate line or device.

steps.expected: Audio from  call should not be audible on the second phone.
steps.instruction: Toggle the mute button (on call screen or call screen -> on keypad) on and speak.

steps.expected: Audio from the call should be audible on the second phone.
steps.instruction: Toggle the mute off (on call screen or call screen -> on keypad) and speak.

objects.description: If two or more calls are made to the same number, they should be bunched accordingly in the call log.
objects.name: [CALL LOG] Make two or more calls to the same number

steps.expected: In the call log, calls to the same number are bunched together with" (2)" following the number string.
steps.instruction: Using the B2G phone, make and terminate two subequent calls to the same number.

steps.expected: In the call log, calls to the same number are similarly bunched.  The correct number of calls to same number is shown in the parentheses following the number string.
steps.instruction: Make several more calls to the same number.

objects.description: When two or more calls are received from the same number, they should be bunched accordingly in the call log.
objects.name: [CALL LOG] Receive 2 or more calls from the same number

steps.expected: In the call log, calls from the same number are bunched together with" (2)" following the number string.
steps.instruction: Using another phone, make and terminate two subequent calls (into the B2G phone) from the same number.

steps.expected: In the call log, calls from the same number are similarly bunched.  The correct number of calls to same number is shown in the parentheses following the number string.
steps.instruction: Make several more calls from the same number.

objects.description: When two or more missed calls are received from the same number, they should be bunched accordingly in the call log.
objects.name: [CALL LOG] Receive 2 or more missed calls from the same number

steps.expected: In both the call log and missed call log, calls from the same number are bunched together with" (2)" following the number string.
steps.instruction: Using another phone, make and terminate two subequent calls (into the B2G phone) from the same number.  Terminate the calls before answering them on B2G phone.

objects.description:

steps.expected: Calls associated with that number are deleted.  If it was a missed call, those related calls are deleted from "missed calls".
steps.instruction: Delete an Answered entry.

Add a first name.
Add a last name.

Add an E-mail.

Add a Zip code.

Add a Comment

objects.description:
It should be possible to edit an existing contact's name and phone number.

#Prerequisites:  
#-User has an Existing Contact created with all fields filled
objects.name: [CONTACTS] Verify an existing contact's name and phone number can be updated

steps.instruction: From the Homescreen, open the Contacts App

steps.expected: The contact's details are displayed
steps.instruction: Navigate to an existing contact with a saved Name and Phone Number.

steps.expected: The edit menu is displayed for that contact
steps.instruction: Tap the Edit button in the top right corner

steps.expected: Contact is saved with new name and all other data is preserved
steps.instruction: Change the name of the contact  then select the "Update" button in the top right corner
Close/Restart the Contacts App

steps.expected: The contact's details are displayed and the updated name for the contact still appears correct
steps.instruction: Navigate to the contact from step 2 and select the updated contact.
Tap the Edit button in the top right corner

steps.expected: Contact is saved with new phone number and all other data is preserved
steps.instruction: Change the phone number of the contact then select the "Update" button in the top right corner

steps.expected: The contact's details are displayed and the updated phone number for the contact still appears correct
steps.instruction: Close/Restart the Contacts App

objects.description:
It should be possible to pin a contact as a "favorite" and add to the favorite list.

Prerequisities:  Contacts app is launched.  More than one contact is available.
objects.name: [CONTACTS] Add contact to favorite list

steps.expected: Contact receives star once is has been added as favorite.  Button text switches to "remove as favorite".  In the Contacts list, there is not an additional "starred" category to which the contact has been added.
steps.instruction: Click the contact that you want to add to "favorites" list.  Without going to edit mode, clink the "Add as favorite" button.

objects.description:
It should be possible to delete a contact from the favourite list.

Prerequisites:  Contact app has been launched.   More than one contact is available, at least one has been added to favorites list.
objects.name: [CONTACTS] Delete a contact from the favourite list

steps.expected: Contact is removed from favorites list, but still exists in all other lists where it appeared before.
steps.instruction: Click the contact you want removed from the list.  Without going into edit mode, click "remove as favorite".

steps.expected: Contact is removed from favorites list.  Contact is also removed from all other lists where it appeared before.
steps.instruction: Add the contact back to the favorites list.  Now, go into edit mode and delete the contact.

objects.description:
It should be possible to send an SMS from a contact.

Prerequisites:  a contact exists  with a phone number.
objects.name: [CONTACTS] Send an sms from a contact detail

steps.expected: Contact launches.  There is a place to call (telephone icon next to number) and an sms button available.
steps.instruction: Select the contact to which you want to send an sms.

steps.expected: SMS application launches.  If there is already an existing thread in progress with the said number, this thread is launched, and populated with previous messages sent back and forth.  If not, an empty message thread is started.
steps.instruction: Hit the SMS button.

steps.expected: Message is sent, as typed to destination number and shows up there.  Message as typed also appears in the message thread.
steps.instruction: type in a message and hit "send".

objects.description:
It should be possible to move an application icon around on the homescreen.

Prerequisites:  
Homescreen is launched and viewable.
objects.name: [HOME SCREEN] Verify the user can move an application around on the homescreen.

steps.instruction: Swipe left once to view first screen with app icons.

steps.expected: Edit mode is launched (Icons appear to pulsate)
steps.instruction: Long tap (>3 seconds) on an app icon

steps.expected: The app icon is moved successfully.
steps.instruction: Hold the icon and move it one screen to the right.

steps.expected: The app icon is moved successfully.
steps.instruction: Hold the icon again and move it one screen to the left.

steps.expected: The app icon is moved successfully. An icons on the top row are moved to the left and down to make space for the app icon getting moved.
steps.instruction: Hold the icon again and move it to the top row.

steps.expected: The app icon is moved successfully. An icons are moved up to make space for the app icon getting moved.
steps.instruction: Hold the icon again and move it to the bottom row.

objects.description: It should be possible to delete an application.  The way to do it is to press "X" on the application's icon when in edit mode.
objects.name: [HOME SCREEN] Delete an application by pressing the button "X" from the edit mode

steps.expected: Edit mode is launched (app icons are vibrating).
steps.instruction: Press home button to go home if not already there.   Long tap (>3 seconds) an app icon to open edit mode.

steps.expected: App is deleted.
steps.instruction: Press "delete" button on an app icon (small X).

steps.expected: Edit mode is closed (no more vibrating icons).  Deleted app icon has been removed.
steps.instruction: Press home button.

objects.description:
As a user I want the ability to toggle Airplane Mode ON in the Settings menu so that I can disable wireless signals from the phone.

Prerequisites: 
#a. Airplane mode must be set to disabled.
#b. Wifi must be connected and active.
#c. GPS is enabled.
#d. Data Connection under the Cellular & Data category must be enabled.
objects.name: [SETTINGS] When you turn Airplane mode on: Wifi, GPS and Cellular Data are turned off

steps.expected: Verify that you see Airplane mode with an option to enable/disable this option.
steps.instruction: Launch Settings and navigate to the Network & Connectivity section.

steps.expected: Airplane mode option will get a check mark to indicate this option is active.
steps.instruction: Tap Airplane mode to On.

steps.expected: Verify that GPS, Wifi and Cellular and Data options are switched off once Airplane mode is enabled.
steps.instruction: Observe the GPS, Wifi and Cellular & Data options.

objects.description:
As a user I want the ability to toggle Airplane Mode OFF in the Settings menu so that I can re-enable wireless signals from the phone.

Prerequisites:
#a. Wifi must have been connected and active when Airplane mode was enabled.
#b. GPS was enabled before Airplane mode was enabled.
#c. Data Connection under the Cellular & Data category must have been enabled before Airplane mode was enabled.
#d. Airplane mode must be set to enabled.
objects.name: [SETTINGS] When you turn Airplane mode off: Wifi, GPS and Cellular Data are turned back on

steps.expected: Verify that you see Airplane mode with an option to enable/disable this option.

objects.description:
It should be possible to scroll vertically through thumbnail photos.

Prerequisite:
#a. Have more than 60 photos on the device so that all of them cannot be seen on the screen at the same time.

*Please see issue: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1015413
objects.name: [Gallery] Scrolling through photos in thumbnail view in the Gallery

steps.expected: Verify the gallery app launches.
steps.instruction: Launch the gallery.

steps.expected:
Verify the thumbnail photo view is populated with photos.  All EXIF orientation data is respected (e.g. photos are oriented correctly).

The pictures are ordered chronologically (most recent on top).

If the amount of pictures cannot be displayed in a single screen, the pictures can be shown by scrolling with a finger gesture.
steps.instruction: Observe the photo thumbnail layout.

steps.expected: Everything scrolls smoothly and all thumbnails appear as they should. (No black screen or gray tiles are shown). Also, verify the user can now see photos that were hidden at the bottom of the screen.
steps.instruction: Swipe up through the thumbnails.

steps.expected: Everything scrolls smoothly and all thumbnails appear as they should. (No black screen or gray tiles are shown). Verify the user can now see photos that were hidden at the top of the screen.
steps.instruction: Swipe down through the thumbnails.

objects.description:
As a user, in LIST VIEW "Select Mode", I should be able to share one or more selected photos by single-tapping the share button in the toolbar. objects.description: If the device does not have enough space the phone will fail any downloads that are too large.

objects.description: Users will be able to stop downloads.

objects.description: A user will be able to restart a stopped package app download.
objects.name: Verify that the user can restart a stopped download of a large packaged app.

steps.instruction: Open the Browser app.
Go to link: http://mozqa.com/webapi-permissions-tests/
Select Packaged App Test Case 6.
While the file is downloading open the notification bar and tap on the download for the package app.
Select Stop Download.

steps.expected: A prompt should appear allowing the user to restart the download of the packaged app
steps.instruction: Once the download failed, turn back on wifi/ data and tap the package app icon on the Home Screen.

steps.expected: The packaged app should start downloading again with a notification shown with the packaged app being installed again.
steps.instruction: Select Download.

objects.description: If a user stops the download of a package app they will be able to cancel the download prompt.
objects.name: Verify that the user can cancel the download prompt of a stopped packaged app.

steps.instruction: Open the Browser app.
Go to link: http://mozqa.com/webapi-permissions-tests/
Select Packaged App Test Case 6
While the file is being downloaded open the notification bar.
Tap on the download for the application and select Stop Download.
After the download stops, tap on the package app icon on the Home Screen.

steps.expected: No download will start for the packaged app.
steps.instruction: Select Cancel on the prompt that is displayed.

objects.description: A friendly error message will be displayed if the network connection is lost while downloading.

objects.description:
Verify that outgoing calls are grouped by contacts and displayed an icon with the number of items in a group of communication. In the missed calls tab, when a contact has two or more telephone numbers, calls from the same contact but different telephone numbers go to different groups. 

Prerequisites: Make sure that the user has more than one call (outgoing, incoming and missed) within each multiple contact
objects.name: [DIALER] Verify that the calls are grouped by contacts (one contact with two phone numbers) and that they display an icon with the number of items in a group of communication.

steps.expected: Find in the call log, missed calls tab, a different group for every different telephone number, that is, two or more groups of missed calls (as much as numbers in the same contact).
steps.instruction:
1. Find a contact with two or more telephone numbers

objects.description:
The device can handle the System Update failing without issue. 

Pre-Setup: 
# turn on wifi on an older build
# record Data and gaia commit number (device information > gaia commit)
# run |force-update-check.sh| after enabling wifi (this sets the updater to appear within 2 minutes)

Suggested Setup:
# Settings > enable DNT
# Settings > Display > Turn off auto brightness
# Settings > Display > Wallpaper > Choose the "Green leaf"
# Settings > Set the screen timeout to Never
# Clock > Set up an alarm
# Browser > bookmark a URL (eg. cnn.com)
# Webapp > install twitter onto homescreen
# move an App into the tooltray (camera)
objects.name: [Updates] System Updates - Update can be Failed

steps.expected:
An update dialog is launched with the options to 
[Later]
[Download]
steps.instruction: Select the system updates notification dialog

steps.expected: The update process beings
steps.instruction: Select Download

steps.expected:
The update process will immediately stop
(logcat: 
* 09-25 22:40:15.570: E/GeckoConsole(1151): AUS:SVC Downloader:onStopRequest - setting state to: download-failed
* 09-25 22:40:15.620: E/GeckoConsole(1151): AUS:SVC Downloader:onStopRequest - all update patch downloads failed)
steps.instruction: Kill the updater process by stopping Wifi or data connection

objects.description:

Pre-Requirements: 
---------------------
Have an older build installed on the device.

An update dialog is launched with the options to 
[Later]
[Download]
steps.instruction: Select the system updates notification dialog

steps.expected: The update process beings
steps.instruction: Select Download

steps.expected:
The update process will immediately stop
(logcat: 
* 09-25 22:40:15.570: E/GeckoConsole(1151): AUS:SVC Downloader:onStopRequest - setting state to: download-failed
* 09-25 22:40:15.620: E/GeckoConsole(1151): AUS:SVC Downloader:onStopRequest - all update patch downloads failed)
steps.instruction: Kill the updater process by stopping Wifi or data connection

steps.expected: The update will resume where it left off.
steps.instruction: re-enable Wifi, and tap the system update notification progress bar

objects.description:
It should be possible to configure email via active sync, and send an email.

Prerequisite:
Have no accounts set up.
objects.name: [EMAIL] Verify the user can send emails via activesync with hotmail.com.

steps.instruction: Open the e-mail app.
Select Manual setup.
Put any name, a valid hotmail account, and password.
Select ActiveSync.

In ActiveSync settings: 
        Hostname = m.hotmail.com 
        Username = same hotmail account used.
Tap on Next.
Select Continue to Mail.
Tap on Compose e-mail icon in the top right.

steps.expected: Email is sent to the destination email address.
steps.instruction: Type in a recipient, subject, message and hit "send".

objects.description:
Once an email account is configured on the phone, it should be possible to receive an email on the device.

Prerequisite:
Have no accounts set up.
objects.name: [EMAIL] Verify the user can receive email via activesync with hotmail.com.

steps.instruction: Send an e-mail to the activesync hotmail account that will be set up on the device.
Open the e-mail app.
Select Manual setup.
Put any name, a valid hotmail account, and password.
Select ActiveSync.

In ActiveSync settings: 
        Hostname = m.hotmail.com 
        Username = same hotmail account used.
Tap on Next.

steps.expected: The email is received on the device, in the correct email inbox.  All of Subject, Recipient, and message data is intact. Incoming email also appears on the phone UI.
steps.instruction: Select Continue to Mail.

steps.expected: The email is received on the device, in the correct email inbox. All of Subject, Recipient, and message data is intact.
steps.instruction: Manual refresh.

objects.description:
From the gallery, it should be possible to view the photos in the fullscreen mode.

Prerequisites:  the gallery application is launched, in thumbnail view.
objects.name: [GALLERY] View photo in fullscreen mode & check orientation

steps.expected: The photo appears in "large" mode, with toolbar (5 icons) below the photo view.
steps.instruction: Click on a thumbnail photo in the gallery to enlarge it.

steps.expected: The photo appears in landscape mode
steps.instruction: Rotate the phone 90 degrees

steps.expected: The photo appears in full screen mode
steps.instruction: Tap on the photo

steps.expected: The photo appears in portrait mode
steps.instruction: Rotate the phone back 90 degrees

steps.expected: The photo appears in "large" mode, with toolbar (5 icons) below the photo view.
steps.instruction: Tap on the photo

objects.description:
It must be possible to create a video using the camera.  The video output should be H.264.  It should be possible to play back the recording from the gallery.
Videos are saved as ".3gp".

Prerequisites: 
Have a micro SD card in the device.
objects.name: [CAMERA] Verify the user can make a video recording.

steps.expected: The camera app will be opened.
steps.instruction: Open the Camera app.

steps.expected: The app will switch to video camera mode.
steps.instruction: Press the Video camera icon.

steps.expected: The device will start to record video.
steps.instruction: Tap on the Video camera icon again.

steps.expected: The device will stop recording. A new video is created and can be found in the gallery app. The video is saved as ".3gp".
steps.instruction: Press the Stop icon again.

objects.description:
It should be possible, using the video functionality, to play back a video that's been shot with the onboard camera.  Both Video and Sound must work.

Prerequisite:   A video has been recorded with sound, using the onboard camera.
objects.name: [Video] Play the video you recorded.  Check for video and sound.

steps.instruction: Open the video app.

steps.expected: Video should play back.  There should be visuals with no gap.  There should be continuous sound in sync with the video, also with no gaps.
steps.instruction: Select recently recorded video.

objects.description:
[UPDATER] Test device can discover and install OTA updates with the previous build installed
** There's a force update script that will find the OTA update within 2 minutes of boot time
** This will need to be ran before the daily update test
** Dependency: need a way to determine the udpated build's ID information (gecko/gaia)
objects.name: [System Updates] Test over-the-air (OTA) updates from previous build (new)

steps.instruction: Install yesterday's build.
Go to the Settings app.
Scroll down and select "Device information".
Click on "Check now".
After the phone see the OTA, open the Notification bar.

steps.expected: OTA update should take place within two minutes.
steps.instruction: Select "Update Available" and download the OTA.
When the prompt to install is display click "Install".
Once the phone starts back up go to the Settings app.
Go down and select "Device Information".

steps.expected: The build ID information will be located in this section.
steps.instruction: Click on "More Information".

objects.description:
User will be able to navigate without any issue while in week view.

#Prerequisite: Month selected January 2014 (days 12, 13, 14, 15, 16, 17, or 18)
objects.name: Verify user can switch to the next week with 7 days in the month

steps.expected: Calendar apps opens
steps.instruction: Open the Calendar App

steps.expected: Month view displays
steps.instruction: Navigate to a month with 7 days in the same month on the same line

steps.expected: Day selected is highlighted in blue
steps.instruction: Tap on any of the first 4 days of the week chosen

steps.expected: Calendar displays in week view
steps.instruction: Tap on the "Week" button in the bottom of the screen

steps.expected: User sees 3 days in the same month
steps.instruction: Swipe to the left on device

objects.description: User able to navigate properly and view all days within a 7 day week that all days occur in the same month
objects.name: Verify user can view previous 4 days for a week with 7 days in the same month

steps.expected: Calendar App opens
steps.instruction: Open the Calendar App

steps.expected: August 2013 displays in Month view
steps.instruction: Navigate to August 2013 on device

steps.expected: Selected day is highlighted in blue
steps.instruction: Select any days between 29 and 31

steps.expected: Week view displays
steps.instruction: Tap on the Week button at bottom of screen

steps.expected: User sees previous four days for that week in the same month
steps.instruction: Swipe to the left on device

objects.description:
User views correct month(s) in calendar view for a selected day in a week that occurs in two months.

#Prerequisites:  Current Month is July 2013
objects.name: Verify correct month(s) display when day selected is for a calendar week of overlapping months

steps.expected: Calendar App opens
steps.instruction: Open the Calendar App

steps.expected: Month view appears for current month
steps.instruction: Tap Month tab at bottom of device

steps.expected: July 28, 29, 30 or 31 is highlighted in blue
steps.instruction: Select July 28,  29, 30 or 31

steps.expected: Calendar view changes from month to weekly view with July August 2013
steps.instruction: Tap the Weekly tab at bottom of device

steps.expected: Calendar dates move in decreasing order with July 2013 displayed for dates before July 28
steps.instruction: Swipe to right on device

objects.description: Verify that the user is able to navigate with ease while on a weekly view by switching to a week where the user can see the overlapping  of two months
objects.name: [Calendar] Test that the user can switch to a previous week that overlaps across two months

steps.expected: Calendar app opens
steps.instruction: Open the Calendar App

steps.expected: User is able to go to June 2013
steps.instruction: Navigate to June 2013

steps.expected: The date is highlighted
steps.instruction: Select June 27th

steps.expected: The week of 27th is found on the screen
steps.instruction: Tap on the "Weekly" button in the bottom of the screen

steps.expected: The user is able to see the overlapping months (JuneJuly 2013) and dates correctly
steps.instruction: Swipe to the right

objects.description:
User sees correct days of week that covers two years in Week view

#Prerequisites: Calendar in Month view
objects.name: Verify user can view days of a week that overlaps two years in Week view

steps.expected: Calendar App opens
steps.instruction: Open the Calendar App

steps.expected: December displays on screen
steps.instruction: Swipe device to December

steps.expected: Day selected highlighted in blue
steps.instruction: Tap day for week that overlaps two years

steps.expected: User sees days of week that overlaps two years
steps.instruction: Tap Week button at bottom of screen

objects.description:
The user will be able to see events while in Week view.

Prerequisite: Have an all day event in a week.
objects.name: [Calendar] Test that the user can view  an all day event for a particular day in a week view

steps.expected: Calendar app opens
steps.instruction: Open the Calendar App

steps.expected: Event information is found below the month
steps.instruction: Select an all day event on month view

steps.expected: User is able to see all day event listed at the top of the day with the event details shown for the correct day in that week
steps.instruction: Tap on the "Week" button in the bottom of the screen

objects.description:
User can see three events on mobile device, two events on a single day and a third event on a different day while viewing in Week view

#Prerequisite: Have two events on one day and one event on a different day in the same week saved on calendar

Tap Drawer from upper left of device and verify offline calendar enabled with blue checkmark
objects.name: Verify user can view two events for a day and one event for a different day in Week View

steps.expected: Calendar App opened
steps.instruction: Open the Calendar App

steps.expected: Day of Week selected is highlighted in blue
steps.instruction: Select Day of Week with three events (two on a single day, one on a different day of that week)

steps.expected: User sees two events for that one day and one event on the other day for that week
steps.instruction: Tap Week button at bottom of screen

objects.description:
Verify that the user will be able to see an extended event on week view

Prerequisite: Have an event that overlaps two weeks
objects.name: [Calendar] Test that the user can view an event that overlaps between current and the following week

steps.expected: Calendar app opens
steps.instruction: Open the Calendar App

steps.expected: The event gets selected and the user is able to see it
steps.instruction: Select the event that spans for two weeks on the month view

steps.expected: The user is able to see the event from the start day and time of the event till the end
steps.instruction: Tap on the "week" button in the bottom of the screen

steps.expected: Upon navigating, the user sees the rest of the event as  "all day" event
steps.instruction: Navigate to the following week

objects.description:
User sees conflicting events in week view on mobile device

#Prerequisite: Have two events that conflict a particular day in the same week
objects.name: Verify user sees two conflicting events for a day in Week view

steps.expected: Calendar App opens
steps.instruction: Open the Calendar App

steps.expected: Selected day is highlighted in blue
steps.instruction: Tap Day with conflicting events

steps.expected: Conflicting events displayed side by side for particular day in that week
steps.instruction: Tap Week button at bottom of page

objects.name: Test that I can preview event details for an event with location, attendees, and a title in the week view

steps.expected: Then I should see a preview of the event with the location, attendees, and title in the week view
steps.instruction: When I click an existing event for a particular day in the week view

objects.description:
The user will be able to see more event details when taping on the event.

#Prerequisite: Have an event in the Calendar.
objects.name: [Calendar] Test that the user can get more event details for an event in preview by tapping an event in the week view

steps.instruction: Open the Calendar App
Select a day that has an event
Tap on the "Week" button in the bottom of the screen

steps.expected: The user will see the full details of the event in edit event mode
steps.instruction: Tap on the event

objects.name: Test that I can dismiss the event preview bubble for previewing an event

steps.expected: Then the event preview for that event shall disappear
steps.instruction: When I tap away from the event preview currently showing in the week view

objects.description:
User adds Event in Week view with Title, Description, and 1 hour time block

#Prerequisites: Default Event Start Time = 12:00 AM, Default Event End Time = 1:00 AM, Tap drawer in upper left and ensure Offline Calendar has blue checkmark
objects.name: Verify user can add an Event while in Week View

steps.expected: Calendar App opens
steps.instruction: Open the Calendar App

steps.expected: Selected day highlighted in blue
steps.instruction: Select any day

steps.expected: Calendar changes to Week view
steps.instruction: Tap "Week" button at bottom of screen

steps.expected: User taken to Add Event page
steps.instruction: Tap (+) in upper right of device

steps.expected: Title field editable
steps.instruction: Tap Title field

steps.expected: Text entered in Title field
steps.instruction: Enter text in Title field

steps.expected: Description Field editable
steps.instruction: Tap Description Field

steps.expected: Text entered in Description Field
steps.instruction: Enter text in Description Field

steps.expected: Event saved and displayed for that day of week
steps.instruction: Tap Save in upper right of device

objects.description: Verify that the user is able to add an all day offline calendar event for a particular day
objects.name: [Calendar] Test that the user can add an all day event to an offline calendar for a particular day

steps.expected: Calendar app is launched
steps.instruction: Open the Calendar App

steps.expected: Selected day is highlighted
steps.instruction: Select any day

steps.expected: Create event screen appears
steps.instruction: Press the "+" button in the top right

steps.expected: The user is able to see the information added on the selected fields
steps.instruction: Add Title, Location, Date and Time

steps.expected: The time field disappears when "All day event?"
steps.instruction: Tap on the check box "All day event?"

steps.expected: User sees the "Offline Calendar" is selected
steps.instruction: Select Offline Calendar

steps.expected: User sees the event is added as an all day event in the month, week, and day views respectively
steps.instruction: Save the event

objects.name: Test that I can add an event with a date and time different than the initial timeslot picked when tapping a time area in the week view for an offline calendar

steps.expected: Then I should be taken to the add event UI with the time and date prefilled
steps.instruction: When I select a timeslot for a day in the week view for an offline calendar

steps.expected: Then I should get a date and time picker respectively, allow me to change the date and time to some new date and time, and confirm the change
steps.instruction: When I modify the date and time for that event already prefilled to a different date and time

steps.expected: Then I should see the event added for the specific date and time specified with the specified title in the month, week, and day views respectively
steps.instruction: When I add an event location and title and submit the event

objects.description:
User able to add events to any type of calendar

#Prerequisite: Google Calendar imported, Tap Drawer from upper left of device and verify Google calendar enabled with blue checkmark, Calendar in Month View
objects.name: Verify user can add all day event to a google calendar for a particular day

steps.expected: Calendar App opens
steps.instruction: Open the Calendar App

steps.expected: Selected day highlighted in blue
steps.instruction: Select any day

steps.expected: Add Event screen opens
steps.instruction: Tap (+) in top right of screen

steps.expected: Title field becomes editable
steps.instruction: Tap Title field

steps.expected: Title field text displays
steps.instruction: Fill in Title field

steps.expected: Blue circle displays with checkmark
steps.instruction: Tap All Day Event blue circle

steps.expected: Description field editable
steps.instruction: Tap Description field

steps.expected: Description field text displays
steps.instruction: Fill in Description field

steps.expected: Calendar Menu opens
steps.instruction: Tap offline calendar button

steps.expected: User's Google Calendar selected in blue with blue checkmark to right
steps.instruction: Tap user's Google Calendar account

steps.expected: Google Calendar enabled and user returned to Add Event screen
steps.instruction: Tap OK button at bottom of screen

steps.expected: Notes field editable
steps.instruction: Tap Notes field

steps.expected: Notes text displays
steps.instruction: Fill in Notes field

steps.expected: Event saved to Google Calendar
steps.instruction: Tap save in upper right of screen

objects.description:
Verify that the user will be able to add an ALL DAY event to a yahoo calendar.

Prerequisite: Have a Yahoo calendar set up
objects.name: [Calendar] Test that the user can add an all day event to a yahoo calendar for a particular day

steps.expected: Calendar app is launched
steps.instruction: Open the Calendar App

steps.expected: The selected day is highlighted
steps.instruction: Select any day

steps.expected: Create event page appears
steps.instruction: Press the "+" button in the top right

steps.expected: The user is able to add title and location
steps.instruction: Add title and location

steps.expected: The user is able select the event as an all day event
steps.instruction: Make the event as an all day event by tapping on the check box next to "All day event?

steps.expected: The user is able to select Yahoo from the calendar account list
steps.instruction: Select Yahoo calendar from the drop down menu

steps.expected: User can save the event as an all day event and can see the same in the month, week, and day views respectively.
steps.instruction: Tap on the "Save" button

objects.description:
Verify that the user will be able to create an ALL DAY event type for a Caldav calendar.

steps.expected: Title and location is added
